metadata.title: CVE-2016-0718 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Expat allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed input document,which triggers a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-4ubuntu0.20.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1ubuntu1').
xmlrpc-c package in esm-apps/focal is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
swish-e package in esm-apps/focal is affected and needs fixing.
cadaver package in esm-apps/focal is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in esm-apps/focal is affected and needs fixing.
firefox package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '48.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
libxmltok package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-4ubuntu0.20.04.1~esm1').
